DOC.brief_summary: In Pico-Union/Koreatown community Los Angeles investigator design preventive health care model increase opportunity family make healthy choice -- home , school & community . The project 's key element : Lay community health worker ( paraprofessional ) - Mentor Mothers ( MM ) ( promotoras ) - make home visit pregnant mother & newly-delivered mother agree participate research study . Investigators hope achieve follow outcome : 1 ) low maternal BMI 6 month post-birth ; 2 ) long duration breastfeeding ; 3 ) less alcohol , smoking , drug use pregnancy ; 4 ) increase consistent prenatal postnatal healthcare adherence . Investigators implement study 6 MMs , maintain average caseload 16 woman across 18-month period . Each participant visit ( receive intervention telephone ) twice per month . Separate Assessment Team member conduct assessment : Baseline , within week birth target child , 6 month birth .
DOC.brief_title: Home Visiting Low Income , Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: After participant mother recruit , screen , consent study , woman contact member Assessment Team schedule in-home Baseline Assessment . The Baseline Assessment take approximately 90 minute complete . Follow-up Assessments take place : within week delivery 6 month delivery . Interviews audio-recorded quality assurance purpose . The domain Follow-up Assessments 1 ) maternal weight , height , eat exercise routine ; 2 ) feeding routine , style , frequency ; 3 ) substance use ; 4 ) adherence health care prenatally postnatally , immunization , illnesses mother baby . Secondarily , investigator assess mother 's pregnancy , general health , mental health , social support , father child , use alternative medicine health care , reproductive health , HIV , relationships violence , baseline knowledge antenatal health , baseline knowledge delivery health , baseline state future plan . All in-home interview take place private room area participant 's home . If in-home interview practical appropriate reason , interviewer conduct interview Robert F. Kennedy Community Schools campus , UCLA , another site . Assessment team in-home interview audio-recorded quality assurance & supervision purpose . Telephone interviews audio-recorded . IN-HOME ( OR TELEPHONE ) MENTOR MOTHER INTERVENTION VISITS : Each participant assign Mentor Mother ( MM ) . Participants receive series twice-monthly , pre- post-natal , in-home ( telephone call ) intervention visit , study period 12 month , assign MM . The MM measure mother 's height & weight intervention home visit , proceed deliver one Intervention Topics ( e.g . nutrition , substance use awareness , infant development etc. ) . After baby bear , Mentor Mother continue record mother 's weight height , also measure weigh infant , enter data study mobile phone . These intervention visit ( phone call ) last approximately 1 hour . The MM address concern question mother , provide referral community resource necessary , leave handout participant mother base day 's intervention topic and/or participant mother 's question day . HEALTH INFORMATION MAILINGS : Pregnant woman receive twice-monthly mailing provide information pregnancy , breastfeeding , nutrition , infant care .
